mil3.3.2:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, concerning that which you said, ‘No earliest point can be discerned,’ please give me an analogy for that.”
mil3.3.2:1.3: “Just as, your majesty, a man might put a small seed in the ground, then having produced a sprout and having gradually undergone increase, growth, and full development, it would ripen into fruit.
mil3.3.2:1.4: Then again having taken from that a seed and cultivated it, then having produced a sprout and having gradually undergone increase, growth, and full development, it would ripen into fruit.
mil3.3.2:1.5: Is there thus an end to this continuity?”
mil3.3.2:1.7: “In the same way, your majesty, no earliest point of transmigration time can be discerned.”
mil3.3.2:6.1: Question on the Earliest Point second
